article_title: Democratic candidates keep it civil in 20th Senate District debate

article_metadata.description: WATERFORD — A week before the primary, the two candidates seeking the Democratic nomination in the state's 20th Senate District answered questions Tuesday in a polite debate.Betsy Ritter and Bill Satti stuck to the issues facing the district rather than attacking each other in the debate sponsored by the League of Women Voters of Southeastern Connecticut.About 150 people packed a meeting room at the Waterford Public Library to hear the candidates, who will face off in a Tuesday primary.
article_metadata.author: John Barry jbarry@norwichbulletin.com (860) 334-2501
